page.title: 08OPINIONS OF AN OLD PERSON
page.content: Mrs Larkin is the oldest resident in West Horndon. She is 95 and moved here in 1957. She liked the village then and still likes it now. There were no shops when she moved in, but pedlars came with food. There used to be a factory, which made farm implements. They won the Queens award for industry and used to fly the Queens flag.They used to hold dances and a baby clinic at the canteen.They used to play on the sports field and now the sports field is derelict.When they left, she said this was the worst thing that happened to the village. She remembers builders collecting money for the village hall which is now run by the people.Mrs Larkin said she thought the school was the most beautiful in England, because of the lovely views over the country side.
